intro: Illicium daibuense, commonly known as the Daibu star anise, is a species of flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Schisandraceae and is characterized by its aromatic, star-shaped fruits that resemble those of the star anise. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has compound leaves with a distinct, spicy scent. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, and it produces berries that contain aromatic seeds used in traditional medicine. The botanical features of Illicium daibuense make it a valuable species for both ecological and medicinal purposes.
